page.title: 15TRAFFIC PROBLEMS-THE BYPASS
page.content: Wadebridge is notorious for its traffic congestion. Every summer there are queues of traffic waiting to get into the town. It can take more than an hour to travel less than a mile. Two main roads{A39}and{A389}join at the end of a narrow bridge. For years a{bypass}has been proposed. This would relieve the town of the {A39}traffic and improve it as a shopping and business centre. During the last 20 years most main road towns in Cornwall have been bypassed. Delay is caused by the cost of building a{second bridge}.The estimated cost for the bypass is{Â£3.4m In 1983 the{Department of Transport} published a proposed route to the north of the town. A final decision about the route and the starting date have not yet been made in 1985.
